legacyDependencies.name: System.Messaging
legacyDependencies.reason: MSMQ is Windows-only, not available in .NET Core/.NET
legacyDependencies.replacement: Azure Service Bus or Azure Storage Queues

legacyDependencies.name: System.ServiceProcess
legacyDependencies.reason: Windows Service API not available in modern .NET

legacyPatterns.modernAlternative: Azure Service Bus, Azure Storage Queues, or RabbitMQ

blockers: Windows Service architecture requires Linux Worker Service pattern
MSMQ is Windows-only and not containerizable
recommendations: Replace MSMQ with Azure Service Bus or Storage Queues
Use .NET 10 with Linux container base image

requiredChanges: Replace MSMQ with Azure messaging service (Service Bus recommended)
Convert Windows Service to Worker Service
Configure Azure Container Apps service binding for message queue

phases.name: Service Architecture Migration
tasks: Replace Windows Service with Worker Service template

phases.name: Messaging Migration
tasks: Replace System.Messaging with Azure Service Bus client
Convert MSMQ queue operations to Service Bus operations
Implement retry policies and error handling

complexityBreakdown.explanation: While the codebase is small and simple (low code complexity), this migration requires significant architectural changes. The Windows Service must become a Worker Service, and MSMQ must be replaced with Azure Service Bus. These are substantial infrastructure and architecture changes despite the small codebase. The main complexity comes from replacing Windows-only technologies with cloud-native alternatives and adapting the deployment model to containers.

risks.mitigation: Maintain XML deserialization capability during transition, implement dual-format support if needed
Understand Azure Service Bus delivery modes and configure appropriately (PeekLock vs ReceiveAndDelete)

risks.risk: Performance differences between MSMQ and Azure Service Bus
risks.mitigation: Test throughput and latency, adjust batch sizes if needed

risks.risk: No existing tests to validate behavior
risks.mitigation: Create integration tests before migration to establish baseline behavior

recommendations: Use Azure Service Bus Standard tier for message queuing to replace MSMQ
Implement .NET 10 Worker Service with BackgroundService pattern
Use System.Text.Json for message serialization instead of XML
Add Application Insights for monitoring and diagnostics
Implement health checks for Container Apps health probes
Use managed identity for Azure Service Bus authentication
Consider adding dead-letter queue handling for failed messages
